intro: Dicrastylis ochrotricha, commonly known as the yellow-flowered grass. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia, characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Dicrastylis ochrotricha is adapted to dry conditions and is part of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses and sedges.
